alert.note: Alert for Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued March 26 at 8:03PM PDT until March 28 at 6:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: .An incoming storm will bring moderate to heavy rain to the Big Sur coastline Sunday evening into early Monday morning. This storm may cause impacts in and near the Colorado Fire and Dolan Fire burn scars. During heavier rainfall, rain rates could reach criteria for debris flows. Highest storm total amounts are forecast to peak around 1.5 inches for the Colorado burn scar and around 3 inches within the Dolan burn scar. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...This Flash Flood Watch is only for the Colorado Fire and Dolan Fire burn scars along the Big Sur Coast. * WHEN...From Sunday evening at 7 pm PDT to Monday morning at 6 am PDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. There is potential for power outages and slides across Highway 1. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Dolan Fire burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
